result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Firminhac

records.addlTxt: Notice of Court-Ordered Community Service Program Enrollment

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew J Firminhac in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to attorney freely, voluntarily and knowingly. There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: Disorderly Conduct. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea. Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement filed with and accepted by the court. Community Service hours as part of the DAGP.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on August 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with T.G. or her residence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars.

(Case called at 11:40 AM)
Defendant Andrew Firminhac appears without counsel.  Attorney Afton Lewis appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on: 7/18/2022 at 2:45 PM
Return Hearing: 8/10/2022 at 9:30 AM
